lead_paragraph: California's Insurance Commissioner today proposed a radical overhaul of the state's health insurance system, recommending the establishment of a government-industry partnership that would no longer tie coverage to employment. The proposal, as outlined by Insurance Commissioner John Garamendi, a Democrat, centers on government-created corporations that would assess fees to be paid by companies and employees and use the proceeds to purchase health coverage for all residents of the state.

headline.main: Official Seeks Overhaul Of California Insurance
